techmeme.title: The European Commission asks Meta for information about its Content Library tool and API under the DSA, following Meta's decision to deprecate CrowdTangle (Natasha Lomas/TechCrunch)
Epic says its games are available on AltStore for iOS in the EU and plans to bring them to Aptoide's iOS store in the EU and ONE Store on Android (Jay Peters/The Verge)
Epic confirms that the Epic Games Store is available to download on Android devices worldwide, in addition to iPhones in the EU (Taylor Lyles/IGN)
Epic launches Epic Games Store on iOS in the EU, offering its games, including Fortnite, and plans to start onboarding third-party devs' games from December (Morgan Meaker/Wired)
EQT agrees to buy PropertyGuru, which runs real estate rental and sale listing sites in SE Asia, for $1.1B in cash; the deal is expected to close by early 2025 (Will Davies/Bloomberg)
